glosses: A thin, small piece of metal that bounces off as it is hammered, forged.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish چاپاق (çapak), ultimately from Proto-Turkic *čalp-. Cognate with Uyghur چاپاق (chapaq, “fump, (eye) gum”), Karakhanid [script needed] (çalpak, “dirt”). Also related to Karakhanid [script needed] (çalpaŋ, “mud”).
